intro: Moldenhawera cuprea var. corymbosa, commonly known as the red-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and attractive addition to native plant gardens.
